Package Server

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
Server.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientHandler extends Object implements Runnable
Class used for communicate client with the server.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor
    Description
    ClientHandler(Socket sock)
    Constructor to initialize the client handler with the provided socket.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler(Socket sock) throws IOException
      Constructor to initialize the client handler with the provided socket.
      Parameters:
      sock - The socket representing the connection to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error while obtaining input and output streams.

  • Method Details

    • Login

      public void Login() throws IOException
      Handles the login process. It reads the username and password sent by the client, verifies the credentials in the database, and sends the appropriate response to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error during communication with the client or database.

    • SignUp

      public void SignUp() throws IOException
      Handles the user sign up process. It reads the required user details from the client, checks if the email already exists in the database, and either creates a new account or informs the client that the account already exists.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error during communication with the client or database.

    • ViewProducts

      public void ViewProducts() throws IOException
      Retrieves the available products from the database and sends the product details to the client. The method sends product information in a loop until all products have been sent, followed by a "Stop" message.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error during communication with the client or database.

    • ViewPurchases

      public void ViewPurchases() throws IOException
      Handles viewing purchases for a specific customer. Reads the customer ID, retrieves purchases from the database, and sends purchase details to the client.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • ViewSuggestedProducts

      public void ViewSuggestedProducts() throws IOException
      Retrieves and sends a list of suggested products from the database to the client. Formats the suggestion date as a string before sending.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • BuyProducts

      public void BuyProducts() throws IOException
      Processes a product purchase request. Validates product availability, updates inventory, and creates a receipt for the purchase.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • CreateReceipt

      public void CreateReceipt(Cart cart) throws IOException
      Creates a receipt for a completed purchase by inserting data into the database.
      Parameters:
      cart - the cart containing purchase details (customer ID, product ID, quantity).
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • SuggestProduct

      public void SuggestProduct() throws IOException
      Handles suggestions for new products from users. Checks if the suggested product already exists; if not, inserts it into the suggested products table.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • DeleteSuggestProdList

      public void DeleteSuggestProdList(String deleteSuggName) throws IOException
      Deletes a specific product suggestion from the database. Checks for existence before attempting deletion.
      Parameters:
      deleteSuggName - the name of the suggested product to delete.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • AddNewProduct

      public void AddNewProduct() throws IOException
      Adds a new product to the inventory based on a suggestion. Validates the suggestion's existence, inserts the product, and deletes the suggestion.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • ReturnProduct

      public void ReturnProduct() throws IOException
      Processes a request to return a previously purchased product. Updates inventory and removes the purchase record.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • DeleteRefaundedProduct

      public void DeleteRefaundedProduct(int idPurchase) throws IOException
      Deletes a refunded product's record from the purchase history.
      Parameters:
      idPurchase - the ID of the purchase to delete.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during communication.

    • run

      public void run()
      The run method continuously listens for client requests and invokes the corresponding method to handle the request (e.g., Login, SignUp, ViewProducts). The server will keep listening for commands until the client closes the connection.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
